entry.title: Reset Mysql Root Password
entry.content:
``` sudo /etc/init.d/mysql stop sudo mysqld_safe —user=mysql —skip-grant-tables —skip-networking & mysql -u root mysql

mysql> UPDATE mysql.user SET Password=PASSWORD(‘YOUR-NEW-MYSQL-PASSWORD’) WHERE User=‘root’; mysql> FLUSH PRIVILEGES; mysql> quit

sudo /etc/init.d/mysql restart

mysql -u root -p Enter password:

```

entry.title: Using Mysql in Ubuntu
entry.content:
``` sudo apt-get install mysql-server sudo apt-get install mysql-workbench sudo apt-get install libmysqlclient-dev

mysql -uroot -p mysql> create database dbname character set utf8; mysql> grant all privileges on . to ‘app’@‘localhost’ identified by ‘******’;

shell>mysql -u -p dbname< init.sql ```
